asset.name: Zodasiran
asset.one_liner: Dual LDL-C and TG reduction via ANGPTL3 silencing with quarterly dosing

target.name: ANGPTL3
target.pathway: Lipid metabolism - inhibits LPL and endothelial lipase

biology.simple_explanation: ANGPTL3 is a liver-secreted protein that inhibits both lipoprotein lipase (LPL) and endothelial lipase. By silencing ANGPTL3, zodasiran unleashes both enzymes, lowering BOTH triglycerides and LDL-cholesterol.
biology.pathway_detail: ANGPTL3 inhibits LPL (clearing TG) and endothelial lipase (clearing HDL phospholipids, affecting LDL metabolism). Loss of ANGPTL3 function leads to reduced LDL-C, TG, and paradoxically increased clearance of atherogenic lipoproteins.

genetic_validation.loss_of_function: ANGPTL3 LoF mutations associated with lower LDL, lower TGs, reduced CV events (familial combined hypolipidemia)

mechanism.how_it_works: Zodasiran silences ANGPTL3 mRNA in hepatocytes, reducing circulating ANGPTL3 protein. This releases inhibition of LPL and endothelial lipase, enabling accelerated clearance of TG-rich and LDL particles.

lead.name: Homozygous Familial Hypercholesterolemia (HoFH)
lead.rationale: Severe genetic dyslipidemia with inadequate LDL control despite max therapy

expansion.name: Mixed Dyslipidemia
expansion.rationale: Dual LDL and TG reduction fills unmet need

bull_case.evidence: LOF mutations show low LDL, low TGs, reduced CV events

bull_case.point: Dual LDL-C (65%) and TG (70%) reduction with quarterly dosing

bull_case.evidence: 65% vs 47% LDL-C reduction, quarterly SC vs monthly IV

bear_case.evidence: Statins and PCSK9 inhibitors already available
bear_case.counter_argument: Different mechanism, additive benefit for high-risk patients
Zodasiran more efficacious, more convenient dosing

bear_case.evidence: Convenience advantage over biologics, not oral drugs
bear_case.counter_argument: For severe patients already on injections, quarterly is improvement

key_debates.question: Can zodasiran demonstrate CV outcomes benefit?
key_debates.bull_view: Genetic validation strong; dual lipid lowering may be superior
key_debates.bear_view: CV outcomes trials expensive and long; may not be conducted
key_debates.what_resolves_it: Phase 3 HoFH data, potential outcomes study

competitive_landscape.differentiation: Zodasiran shows higher efficacy (65% vs 47%), quarterly SC vs monthly IV

catalysts.what_to_watch: LDL-C reduction vs placebo in HoFH
